author: Ron Kohavi
title: Scaling Up the Accuracy of Naive-Bayes Classifiers: A Decision-Tree Hybrid
window: which is a Bayes network restricted to a tree topology. The results are promising and running times should scale up, but the approach is still restrictive. For example, their accuracy for the Chess dataset, which contains high-order interactions is about 93%, much lower then C4.5 and NBTree, which achieve accuracies above 99%.
